<!-- Generated by documentation.js. Update this documentation by updating the source code. -->

## corporationHistory

Get a list of all the corporations a corporation has been a member of

### Parameters

-   `corporationID`  
-   `corpID`  {number} The corporation to get the corporation history of.

Returns **\[[number][1]]** A array of corporation IDs.

## icons

Get the icon urls for a corporation.

### Parameters

-   `corporationID`  
-   `corpID`  {number} The corporation ID to get the icon of.

Returns **[object][2]** Links to the different sizes of the corporation icon.

## info

Get public information about a corporation.

### Parameters

-   `corporationID`  
-   `corpID`  {number} The corporation ID to get info from.

Returns **[object][2]** Public info on the corporation.

## npcCorps

Get a list of npc corporations.

Returns **\[[number][1]]** A array of all NPC corporations.

## blueprints

Get corporation blueprints

### Parameters

-   `corporationID` **[number][1]** 
-   `page` **[number][1]** Which page of results to return. Defaults to 1 (optional, default `1`)

Returns **any** a list of blueprints the corporation owns.

## secureContainerLogs

Get all corporation ALSC logs

### Parameters

-   `corporationID` **[number][1]** 
-   `page` **[number][1]** Which page of results to return. Defaults to 1 (optional, default `1`)

Returns **any** logs recorded in the past seven days from all audit log secure containers (ALSC) owned by a given corporation.

## assets

Get corporation assets.

### Parameters

-   `corporationID` **[number][1]** 

Returns **[JSON][3]** A list of the corporations assets.

## locations

Get corporation asset locations.

### Parameters

-   `corporationID` **[number][1]** 
-   `itemIDs` **\[[number][1]]**  (optional, default `[]`)

Returns **[JSON][3]** Locations for a set of item ids, which you can get from corporation assets endpoint. Coordinates for items in hangars or stations are set to (0,0,0)

## names

Get corporation asset names.

### Parameters

-   `corporationID` **[number][1]** 
-   `itemIDs` **\[[number][1]]** 

Returns **[JSON][3]** Names for a set of item ids, which you can get from corporation assets endpoint. Typically used for items that can customize names, like containers or ships.

## bookmarks

List corporation bookmarks

### Parameters

-   `corporationID` **[number][1]** 

Returns **[JSON][3]** A list of your corporation’s personal bookmarks.

## folders

List corporation bookmark folders

### Parameters

-   `corporationID` **[number][1]** 

Returns **[JSON][3]** A list of your corporation’s personal bookmark folders.

## contacts

Get corporation contacts.

### Parameters

-   `corporationID` **[number][1]** 

Returns **[JSON][3]** 

## labels

Get corporation contact labels

### Parameters

-   `corporationID` **[number][1]** 

Returns **any** esi-corporations.read_contacts.v1

## contracts

Get corporation contracts.

### Parameters

-   `corporationID` **[number][1]** 

Returns **any** contracts available to a corporation, only if the corporation is issuer, acceptor or assignee. Only returns contracts no older than 30 days, or if the status is "in_progress".

## bids

Get corporation contract bids.

### Parameters

-   `corporationID` **[number][1]** 
-   `contractID` **[number][1]** 

Returns **any** bids on a particular auction contract.

## items

Get corporation contract items.

### Parameters

-   `corporationID` **[number][1]** 
-   `contractID` **[number][1]** 

Returns **any** items of a particular contract.

## getSettings

Gets the settings for esiJS.

Returns **[JSON][3]** A JSON object with the settings.

## setSettings

Sets the settings for esiJS.

### Parameters

-   `$0` **[Object][2]** 
    -   `$0.route`  
    -   `$0.authToken`  
    -   `$0.language`  
    -   `$0.programName`  
-   `route` **[string][4]** Any of the valid routes through ESI.
-   `authToken` **[string][4]** A valid auth token.
-   `language` **[string][4]** A valid language code.
-   `programName` **[string][4]** The name of your project, used by esiJS to pass in as a header.

Returns **[Boolean][5]** True if it was able to sucessfully write. Otherwise, a error.

## sleep

Pause execution of code for a specified amount of time.

### Parameters

-   `millis` **[number][1]** The time to delay (in milliseconds)

Returns **[Promise][6]&lt;[function][7]>**
